title: Corridors Out (with Andrew RT Davies)
itunes:title: Corridors Out (with Andrew RT Davies)
description:
Andrew RT Davies, leader of the Welsh Conservatives, says he bitterly regrets that anyone who signed up to help allied forces as well as some UK nationals have been left in a predicament in Afghanistan. He also tells Bloomberg Westminster's Caroline Hepker why Wales needs it's own public inquiry into the handling of Covid.

Dr James Caron, Lecturer in Islamicate South Asia at SOAS University of London, says the Taliban are angling for international recognition and financial aid, and are attempting to assimilate bureaucrats as the country faces the worst draught in its history.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
content:encoded:
Andrew RT Davies, leader of the Welsh Conservatives, says he bitterly regrets that anyone who signed up to help allied forces as well as some UK nationals have been left in a predicament in Afghanistan. He also tells Bloomberg Westminster's Caroline Hepker why Wales needs it's own public inquiry into the handling of Covid.

Dr James Caron, Lecturer in Islamicate South Asia at SOAS University of London, says the Taliban are angling for international recognition and financial aid, and are attempting to assimilate bureaucrats as the country faces the worst draught in its history.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
itunes:author: Bloomberg
